function.description:
Runs a command line application and returns the output of the process.
`arguments` must contain a valid path to an executable file as the first value, optionally followed by zero or more command line arguments. These arguments should be specified one by one. `directory` is the working directory where the command will be executed.
Returns an OBJECT variable containing:
|Field|Description| |-----|-----------| |`errors`|A string of error messages| |`output`|A string of output lines| |`runtime`|The runtime in milliseconds| |`exitCode`|The exit code of the process|

example.title: Usage
Usage
example.header:
Copying a file in a specified working directory. In this specific example, the working directory is specified as `C:/tmp`. The file `source.jpg` is copied and the name of the new file is `target.jpg`. The copy, i.e. `target.jpg`, is created in the specified working directory, in this case `C:/tmp`.
Example output: {"errors":"","output":" 1 file(s) copied.\r\n","runtime":40,"exitCode":0}.
